content: I just found https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3070 which has been approved by something like 9 people now. Is there someone in charge of reviewing these? Is it ok if I merge it myself?
Giving it a team label might help. Or just pinging someone on whatever team is responsible for deciding the relevant convention.
T-doc doesn't really exist any more though
I guess rustdoc is sort of close? but I don't think this is super relevant to rustdoc

I'm just going to merge it unless someone objects. These are just commenting examples and the module name is unrelated to the surrounding content. tests is more common, though I don't think the exact name matters here.

@Joshua Nelson Diffusion of responsibility; someone with commit access has to take responsibility for merging, as Eric just did. Slight policy vacuum but primarily a lack of clear team/individual responsibility assigned.
